metadata.Description: Inequalities in access to and control over energy resources and services based on gender.

entities.Description: The process of assessing the implications for women and men of any planned action, including legislation, policies, or programs.

relations.Description: Gender disparities in energy can be addressed by implementing gender mainstreaming strategies that ensure equal access and benefits for all genders.
relations.Subject: gender disparities in energy

relations.Description: To reduce gender disparities in energy, funding can be allocated to support gender-focused energy projects that empower women and marginalized groups.
relations.Subject: gender disparities in energy

relations.Description: Addressing gender disparities in energy requires a focus on developing gender-responsive energy policies that consider the specific needs and challenges faced by different genders.
relations.Subject: gender disparities in energy

relations.Description: Gender disparities exist in the energy sector, where women are underrepresented in decision-making roles and face barriers to accessing energy services and opportunities.
relations.Subject: gender disparities in energy

relations.Description: To address gender disparities in energy, partnerships can be formed with women's empowerment organizations to promote gender equality and women's participation in the energy sector.
relations.Subject: gender disparities in energy

relations.Description: Reducing gender disparities in energy is crucial for achieving the sustainable development goals, as gender equality is a key component of sustainable development.
relations.Subject: gender disparities in energy

relations.Object: gender data in the energy sector
relations.Description: Monitoring gender data in the energy sector is important to identify and address gender disparities, and to track progress towards gender equality in the energy sector.
relations.Subject: gender disparities in energy

relations.Description: Setting targets for achieving gender equality in energy access can help drive efforts to reduce gender disparities and ensure equal access to energy services for all genders.
relations.Subject: gender disparities in energy

relations.Object: gender-based violence in the energy sector
relations.Description: Addressing gender disparities in energy also involves addressing gender-based violence in the energy sector, which disproportionately affects women and girls.
relations.Subject: gender disparities in energy
gender mainstreaming
relations.Description: Gender mainstreaming addresses gender inequality in the energy sector, promoting equal opportunities and representation for all genders.

relations.Subject: gender mainstreaming
relations.Description: Gender mainstreaming employs gender experts who provide guidance and expertise in integrating gender perspectives into sustainable energy projects.

relations.Subject: gender mainstreaming
relations.Description: Gender mainstreaming collaborates with women's rights organizations to ensure the inclusion and empowerment of women in the energy sector.

relations.Subject: gender mainstreaming
relations.Description: Gender mainstreaming supports gender equality in the energy sector, advocating for equal rights, opportunities, and representation for all genders.

relations.Subject: gender mainstreaming
relations.Description: Gender mainstreaming administers a program that promotes the integration of gender perspectives into sustainable energy policies and practices.

relations.Subject: gender mainstreaming
relations.Description: Gender mainstreaming measures gender disparities in the energy sector, identifying areas for improvement and targeted interventions.

relations.Subject: gender mainstreaming
relations.Description: Gender mainstreaming aligns with the UN Sustainable Development Goals, particularly Goal 5 on gender equality and Goal 7 on sustainable energy.

relations.Subject: gender mainstreaming
relations.Description: Gender mainstreaming is an instance of inclusive energy planning, which aims to ensure the equitable and inclusive distribution of energy resources.

relations.Subject: gender mainstreaming
relations.Description: Gender mainstreaming addresses gender inequality in the energy sector, promoting equal opportunities and representation for all genders.

relations.Subject: gender disparities in energy
relations.Description: Gender Disparities in Energy addresses gender inequality by promoting equal access to and participation in the energy sector.

relations.Subject: gender disparities in energy
relations.Description: Gender disparities in energy can be addressed by implementing gender mainstreaming strategies that ensure equal access and benefits for all genders.

Access to energy is a key sub-element of gender disparities in energy. It refers to the availability and affordability of energy services for different genders. Gender disparities in access to energy can result in unequal opportunities and hinder socio-economic development.
relations.Subject: access to energy

relations.Description: Energy poverty is another sub-element of gender disparities in energy. It refers to the lack of access to modern energy services, particularly among marginalized and vulnerable groups. Gender disparities in energy poverty can exacerbate existing inequalities and limit opportunities for women and girls.
relations.Subject: energy poverty

relations.Description: Energy consumption patterns are also a sub-element of gender disparities in energy. It refers to the different ways in which men and women use and consume energy. Gender disparities in energy consumption patterns can reflect unequal power dynamics and social norms, leading to inefficient and unsustainable energy practices.
relations.Subject: energy consumption patterns

relations.Description: Energy efficiency is a sub-element of gender disparities in energy. It refers to the ability to achieve the same or better energy services with less energy input. Gender disparities in energy efficiency can result from unequal access to energy-efficient technologies and practices, leading to higher energy costs and environmental impacts.
relations.Subject: energy efficiency

relations.Description: Energy affordability is another sub-element of gender disparities in energy. It refers to the ability to afford energy services and meet basic energy needs. Gender disparities in energy affordability can result in energy poverty and limit opportunities for women and girls, particularly in low-income households.
relations.Subject: energy affordability
